metadata.title: CVE-2016-6897 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in thewp_ajax_update_plugin function in wp-admin/includes/ajax-actions.php inWordPress before 4.6 allows remote attackers to hijack the authenticationof subscribers for /dev/random read operations by leveraging a late call tothe check_ajax_referer function, a related issue to CVE-2016-6896.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.6.1+dfsg-1').
